content.description: This climb starts on top of  the large dislodged boulder under the roof.  Look for the corner with the overhanging arete. Recommended stick clip as a hard campus move to a large ledge  and a high left heel is the start.  The crux continues until the 3rd bolt.  Get a great rest and continue cranking on to the anchors.
content.location: starts on top of  the large dislodged boulder under the roof.

content.description: Climb up through some good holds to the last bolt below the roof.  Trend out slightly right to find the good blocky edges to pull the bulge.  An interesting mantle and shimmy will lead you to the anchors.
content.location: On the tall face of superman crag look for the hueco to the right of the large roof.  This climb start just below and slightly right of the hueco.

climbs.name: Doomsday
climbs.fa: Bolted: Marshall Gilbert, FA: Aaron Parlier

content.description: Stick clip first bolt. Start below the ledge and with the small crimp to jump up (or add a few moves and start further right as per Krypton). Work slightly left along the ledge, then trend up technical terrain towards the first bolt along the left side of the flake shield. Negotiate the flake/rail sequence to gain the side-pull pinch. Channel your inner super powers to get to the half pad crimp and over to the 3rd bolt. Continue trending up and left where steeper climbing will lead you to a fun dyno to find the anchors.
content.location: Left of Krypton, to the right of Superman Arete (this begins to the immediate right of the roof).

climbs.name: Daily Planet
climbs.fa: FA: Emmet O’Brien, developed: Marshall Gilbert

content.description: The furthest right route on the crag.  Look for the circular hueco and go about 10 feet to the right, but not past the chossy crack which leads into a low bulging roof.
content.location: The furthest right route on the crag.

content.description: Similar approach to the Mammal wall, but take a right after dropping into lower Jaybird and follow the trail towards center Jaybird.  There will be a smaller boulder/crag, pass this and then you will see the Beautiful Super Man crag (named after a toy Super Man truck found under the roof).
